intro: Orthosiphon ruber, commonly known as red horsewhip, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are often reddish in color. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink, arranged in dense spikes. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in its native habitat.
